title: Wind Cave National Park: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       Fees Entrance Fees There are no fees to drive through or hike in the park. Enjoy! Cave Tour Fees Tickets for most cave tours are sold on a first-come, first-served basis. Reservations are accepted for schools or large groups, the Historic Candlelight Tour (strongly recommended), and the Wild Cave Tour (required). Groups need to make arrangements several weeks in advance. Call 605-745-4600 for group information or reservations.       Garden of Eden Natural Entrance  Fairgrounds  Candlelight  Wild Cave     Adults (17+)  $10  $12  $12  $12  $30    Children (6-16)  $5  $6  $6  **  Not permitted    5 and under  Free  Free  Free  Not permitted  Not permitted    Senior/Access Pass*  $5  $6  $6  $6      *Price applies only to cardholders. **Minimum age for Candlelight Tour is 8 years old. Tickets for children 8-16 cost $6. Tours for Visitors with Special Needs - $5.00 for adults 17 and older, $2.50 for children 6-16, children 5 and under are free, $2.50 for holders of the Golden Age (Senior)/Access Passports. Sign-language capable rangers are available for the hearing impaired. Camping Fees Camp where the prairie meets the forest at the Elk Mountain Campground. The fee is $18.00 per site per night regularly, and $9.00 per site per night when the water is turned off (generally November through March). Visitors holding a Senior or Access Pass, or a Golden Age or Golden Access Pass pay half price a night per site.  Â    Passes & Special Use Fees America the Beautiful:  National Park & Federal Recreational Lands Pass As of 2007 the Golden Age, Golden Eagle, and Golden Access passes were replaced with a new series of interagency passes call the America the Beautiful - National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass. Passes can be purchased at the Wind Cave visitor center and at any staffed entrance station throughout the National Park System. Annual Pass* - Cost $80  Available to the general public and provides access to, and use of, federal recreation sites that charge an entrance fee for a full year from month of purchase. 4th Grader Pass - Free  Available to U.S. 4th graders or home school equivalents with a valid Every Kid in a Park paper voucher. Valid for the duration of the 4th grade school year through the following summer (September - August). The pass covers tour fees for the 4th grader and immediate family on the Garden of Eden, Natural Entrance, or Fairgrounds tours. Learn more at the Every Kid in a Park website. Senior Pass - Cost $10  A lifetime pass for U.S. citizens and permanent residents age 62 and over. The Senior/Golden Age Pass provides half price tickets for the cardholder only. Access Pass - Free  A lifetime pass for U.S. citizens and permanent residents with permanent disabilities. The Access Pass provides half price tickets for the cardholder only. Military Pass* - Free  Available to active duty military personnel and dependents with proper identification (CAC Card or DD Form 1173) for a full year from month of purchase. Volunteer Pass* - Free  Volunteers who acquire 250 service hours on a cumulative basis are eligible for this pass. It provides access to, and use of, federal recreation sites that charge an entrance fee for a full year from month of award. *NOTE:  The Annual, Military, and Volunteer passes do not waive Expanded Amenity Fees such as cave tours.    Special Use Fees There are also fees associated with special park uses including special events and professional photography. These activities need a special use permit.
